alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 08 at 6:31PM EDT until August 09 at 3:39AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine... Presumpscot River At West Falmouth affecting Cumberland County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Presumpscot River at West Falmouth. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water approaches the backyards of properties along Water Street in Westbrook and Riverside Street in Portland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 13.9 feet. - The river will rise above bankfull by 7 PM. - The river continues to rise. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 14.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening to 8.6 feet Thursday evening. It will rise to 8.8 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
